comments.body: this would be a funny idea. but unless you want to pull a joke with some friends it's not very practical.
Really like this idea! Great way to please both crowds, and gives a lot of room for expansion and more shields.
It should only be accessible to you after you'very killed the enderdragon.

I mean I guess if you're able to collect 12 wither stars before killing the Ender Dragon, you could cheat you're way out of the End but I don't think you can make portals in the End. Therefore, there is no other way to obtain endstone.
And you can't leave the End with your endstone without killing the Ender Dragon.

@Blocknerd, thats not true, you can bring an ender chest through the portal, drop stuff (like endstone) in it and then jump off the void and you cheated your way to obtain endstone without killing the dragon. That is why you should have to kill the dragon first.
I don't think that end portal frames should be craft-able, if you need to get to the end quickly use nether portals to get there.

If someone is willing to sacrifice their life by jumping into the void just for an end portal when they already visited the End, so be it. And also I don't understand your thought process when you say you can get to the End using Nether portals.
BlockNerd, what I meant was that you could make nether portals to get to the stronghold faster.
I wish it would be as simple as using silk tuck and breaking the end portal frames then take them back to ur base (my base is redstone :) )
Could also be used as traps :)

Dragonmail

Dragonmail would be a new material crafted out of Dragon Scales and a new End ore found on the underside of End islands.

Dragonmail Armor has Fall Resistance, and some other bonus (not sure what)

This Armor would be about as good as Netherite normally, but better if you use Elytra. The Armor would distribute its Armor points evenly across each piece, so you would have more armor without the Chestplate than you would wearing Netherite without a Chestplate.

The Armor points would be considered separate from other Armor, or maybe be decreased when wearing other Armor so that it wouldn't be possible to go over 20 Armor points.

 

For the Weapons I'm not too sure, maybe they teleport to safety if you die in the Void, or just stay in the Players inventory upon Death, I dunno.

Good idea, but it should be a netherite upgrade, as it seems the devs donâ€™t want players to go through the hassle of enchanting an entire set fully again, just for one or two added bonuses, however it could be a counterpart. However this must be an end game feature as it is found in the end, so it will need to be better than netherite in some way.
I like the dragonmail idea, but I think it should be dropped by the Ender dragon. The Ender dragon will drop 1 scale, every time it dies after respawning it. This will make the respawning mechanic much more used and valued. The armour should be fire resistant, as the Ender dragon is immune to fire, and should also teleport back to the player if it falls or is dropped into the void.

As for the tools, they should be faster than netherite and donâ€™t burn or die in the void.

As for the sword, it can be upgraded to a new sword with a completely fresh sprite. This can have another name, like The Dragons Blade, or Bane Of The Dragon. The sword, when held in the players hand will give an aura of dragons breath around the player, damaging all end mobs (Endermen, endermite and shulkers). This sword will also have a chance when it attacks a mob to inflict it with a new potion effect, gravity. This will pull mobs from a certain radius maybe 4 or 5 blocks in towards the mob that was hit for a short duration of time, maybe 3 seconds, excluding neutral mobs and creepers, of course. This would be a great mechanic and add more reward to the end game.
I was also thinking gravity could be an enchantment also, only found in end cities and can be applied to bows or crossbows.
Gravity applied to bows and crossbows is nice but it definitely wound need to be added to swords to make easy work of mobs using the sweeping mechanic.

Thinking about it, another possibility for Dragonmail is that it could be used to Upgrade the Elytra, giving it more Durability and about 2-5 Armor points. (as well as possibly allowing Protection Enchantments)

Adding on to that idea, Wearing pieces of Dragonmail Armor could increase the Armor Points of the Dragonmail Elytra, giving Players reason to specifically use Dragonmail Armor with the Elytra.

 

(oh and in case anyone tries to say it, no Elytra are not Dragon wings, they are a real world thing. They're the cases that protect insects' wings, so it wouldn't be weird to use Dragon Scales to upgrade them in that sense)
Sounds awesome!
This would add better sounding music good suggestion

Either that or there could be new block that plays as long as it's powered. It could sound weird if you had continuously playing sound of some plucked string instrument. And it could be bit tricky to time deactivating note block to get sounds of just right lenght 
But yeah, I wish, there would be a block to make continuous sound, like that of flute, pipe organ, hurdy-gurdy

This is great idea, though this post would probably be more effective if you put less focus on why basalt is bad, and more focus on what versions of basalt there could be.

Yeah I think more regular and polished basalt variants would be really cool. Stairs, slabs, maybe even pressure plates and walls, etc. Basalt and especially polished basalt looks really cool, so being able to make that stuff with it would be really nice, just like what you can do with blackstone.
This has been partially added in the form of Smooth Basalt!!!

I love that when it's not christmastime that it's cracked, that's pretty darn good.

maybe they could even add sleighbells to a more piano based song they already have, as a little winky wink, a lil' hello.

I think this would be great for little server parties. Setting a cool mood. idk, it's fun, I like it.
i think it should stay a Christmas song all year

I came on here to post about what just that.

IMHO: Mending should stay as one book, but it should be much rarer than it is now. Someone mentioned to me that mending should be found in the upcoming cavecities, or traded in the new cavecities.

Another go at it is to place them in The End with new structures?

I started a new save when 1.18 came out and my friend had 10 trading villagers before even getting diamond tools. Too overpowered.

"The objective in this is stopping from players to rely on Mending to repair their items and using other methods"

What other methods? You know that repairing in an anvil only works a limited amount of times.

After reading this and you Reddit post it looks like you a just salty because your friend knows how to use end game mechanics.

I agree, mending is far too good for how easy and early you can get it.

I think its important that we acknowledge that we don't need tools to be unbreakable. The most expensive tool is 3 diamonds and that can be gotten with literally one diamond ore mined with a fortune 3 pickaxe. Villagers make enchanting easier than mining cobble so there is no real challenge to making new enchanted tools when one breaks.

About mending having levels suggestion. I think levels don't fix the issue, I believe we need to change how a player obtains mending completely. Also even if it has an extremely low chance of being traded the chance is still there so the player can still just break and place the lectern until they get Mending III.

Someone suggested putting them exclusively in the end as loot. I think this is a decent idea since it makes it true end game loot and requires players to defeat the end dragon before they get such a overpowered enchant. Though this idea doesn't solve the issue of everything having mending at the post-endgame.

My idea would be to make a boss drop it. That way players have to defeat the boss for every piece of gear they want mending on. This still lets players who really want mending to get it on everything but others might choose to live without it since making new equipment is easy enough.

I think if we implement either of the ideas the issue of mending being obtained too early would be solved but other issues would still exist. I'm out of characters :(
Not medieval, but I guess it would be fantasy, for it to be in the game.

There was a post for vanilla bean. Could be a tie-in where with milk they make cream that you freeze on a water block completely adjacent to ice. Though, if you were to have parity, uniformity across platforms (including Education), then you need a kinetic force (and salt); something, to stir it as it sits in a bucket in water, or more precisely, as the bucket turns around a stationary stirring device.

Edit, you use salt to melt a block of ice to start it.
nah not very Minecrafty
So it just floats were you drop it.
How would you retrieve it from the void?
I don't think we need to have a void-resistant material - instead we should have some floating or anti-gravity ores, and that's why all end islands float.
ender amethyst ore
I too have been making buildings that are ruins or run-down and would love to be able to add, cracked glass panes, blocks. Maybe even broken glass panes (like somebody through a rock through them).

This idea also occurred to me. I think the cracked glass could have been created by toasting the glass block in the oven or by breaking the glass blocks with a new tool - a glass cutter. A glass cutter, like a brush, would gradually change the glass, creating new cracks on it (right mouse button).

I think the name fotlr the enchantment would be better called "Ricochet", but it sounds a lot like the "Piercing" enchantment, and it would be op if it was always ricocheting shots. So, I think the arrows should ricochet off targets in the direction of other mobs, so that there is a chance it will hit, but not always.

+1

But I like the name Ricochet more as it by definition is a bullet bouncing of objects, which I believe is more fitting.

Important improvement: The burned tree should not only exist in the vicinity of a new volcano biome but also a normal tree should become a burned tree if it is lightning by set of fire or if it is lit and of course it has no leaves.
maybe it could be obtained by placing logs in the nether

I think a fantasy Cinder Tree would be nice. It would allow players to grow it and not have to burn wood. Also it shouldn't have leaves and instead have a few branch block, kinda like mangrove root blocks.
